meanings.definition: A small circle whose center moves around the circumference of a larger circle.
meanings.sent1: The epicycle in the model showed how a small circle moved around a bigger circle.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers used the concept of an epicycle to explain the movement of planets.
meanings.sent3: The epicycle decided to take a stroll around the larger circle for some exercise.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts revolved like an epicycle around the central idea of the project.
meanings.sent5: The image of the epicycle orbiting the larger circle stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: A circle whose center is on the circumference of another circle.
meanings.sent1: The epicycle was drawn with its center exactly on the edge of the larger circle.
meanings.sent2: The diagram included an epicycle positioned precisely on the circumference of the main circle.
meanings.sent3: The epicycle liked living life on the edge of the bigger circle.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like an epicycle, always on the outer edge of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The epicycle on the circle's edge added an interesting twist to the design.
